Reviews.Title: “fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: Laura D
Reviews.Content: We hosted our engagement party at the lord Nelson on Saturday. The staff were really helpfull and friendly, The location is perfect, central with gorgeous homely decor. The food was lovely and reasonably priced & the beer is the best in Sydney! We cannot recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: yukonimj
Reviews.Content: Great location at a great price. Reservations done by email and easy peasy. Room was a little on the small side and somewhat unremarkable but the bed was comfortable and we slept like a log! Did I mention what a fabulous location it was????

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Beer, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: HaroldandSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 201 for five days and almost everything was great. Great location and the main reason to recommend the hotel. Great pub and beer and great staff! The only issue we had was all drain pipes in the hotel go past 201. Suggest 302, 303 or 304. Other that, we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, service, relaxed atmosphere and the rustic, renovated rooms. We did not eat dinner in the hotel, but recommend Fish on the Rocks about 30 meters down the road. We would stay here again, but in a different room. Great value for,the $$ here

Reviews.Title: “a unique place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Silas K
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely room at the Lord Nelson. I was concerned that the pub downstairs might be too noisy, but that wasn't an issue. In fact the brewery was a nice amenity (with some tasty beer!)

Reviews.Title: “More interesting than staying at a bland hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louieathens
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this old hotel. Our room with ensuite was spacious enough and comfortable although it was not very well lit, another couple of lamps would have been good. Be aware you have to climb stairs to your room, we were on the third floor and so had 3 flights to go up and down.The bar was brilliant, always full of customers and the staff were pleasant. We had an evening meal at the bar, service and food was prompt. Great selection of beers. The best location for accessing the CBD, 10 minutes stroll to Circular Quay. Food at the Rocks restaurant just across the street was fabulous and the little sandwich bar across the street was perfect for a quick lunch. Would stay here again and would recommend but would always get a room with ensuite.

Reviews.Title: “Rocks District...convenient, but out of the way of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: gfmOhio
Reviews.Content: We spent five days here after a cruise around New Zealand. We were very pleased with the location to the central business district and bus line. The staff were very accomodating. We enjoyed a filling continental breakfast each morning, which was included in the room price. They have free internet, but the service is sporadic, especially in the evening. The English atmosphere was really appealing in the Pub, which was the first floor. We were there on St. Paddy's Day, but were not disturbed late at night by the partying. It was a great choice for our very first visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Expatozzie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose to stay at the Lord Nelson as it was close to the Opera House where we were going to see a show. The hotel has two options on rooms, we opted for one with a bathroom. The room itself was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The bar downstairs has great atmosphere and the beer is delicious. The complimentary breakfast was ok. I would recommend this hotel if you wanted something close to Circular Quay/The Rocks, otherwise it would be too much of a hike to the city centre. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: History and the stone work make this a worthwhile visit-and the beer is nice and cold as well. W also dinned which was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Character!”
Reviews.Author: RicknElsie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located just a short walk to the Rocks on the opposite side of the Harbour Bridge. Location is just a 20 minute walk or so down Kent St to Darling Harbour. Good restaurant inside the hotel or just down the block or many within a 10 minute walk to the Rocks! Continental breakfast was nice with coffee/tea, cereals, yogurt, fruit plate, toast & jams. Our room was Very Small. I mean Very Small. Apparently there's 2 rooms with shared ensuite (that wasn't a problem) but we had the smallest room of the 2 rooms without an ensuite. Realistically, our room is not meant for a couple adults. So, I would recommend choosing a room with an ensuite. The room was quiet as the bar closes at 11pm. Lot's of taxis come past so no need to call for one. Close to Circular Quay, Opera House, downtown and the ferries. We did manage to get free wifi. Overall, a good experience except for our "shoebox" size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great beer, great accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_WarEagle
Reviews.Content: If you like beer (and I mean real beer, not fake beer like Fosters) then this is your place! Not only do they serve six varieties of great beer that they brew on site in their pub, their lodging is great too. Amazingly quiet for having a lively brewpub downstairs. Perfect location, close to the rocks with all of the tourist attractions like the Sydney Opera House, and Harbour, as well as many great food options within 5 minutes walk on Argyle St. They are also close to the Observatory and great views of the city (I had great views from my room). Continental breakfast was served in the morning with basics like cereal and toast. More substantial options were also available for an additional charge (for around $16). Parking was plentiful on the streets nearby (free after 6pm, 2.20 an hour from 8-6pm). Americans may find the room to be small, but it was all I needed. They also had free wifi (for a short time).

Reviews.Title: “Great Pub!”
Reviews.Author: SlotF16
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay at the hotel, however we did eat in the pub and the dining room upstairs. Great craft beers in the pub with old English atmosphere. Pub food was excellent. Fish and Chips were great. Upstairs for dinner we had the lobster, crab and chili spaghettini dinner - exceptional food in a great restaurant. Will be back on our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Value, character, soul - Lord Nelson has it all”
Reviews.Author: goneshoeshopping
Reviews.Content: For the ambience, the location, the character and above all â€“ the price â€“ you cannot beat the Lord Nelson. Tucked away in a pretty, historical area of The Rocks within 10 minutes walk of Circular Quay, this is the antidote to standard, clinical hotel. Do not stay here if you prefer chain or touristy hotels... however, if the idea of stone walls, cheerful pub chatter and simple but character-filled rooms in a hotel that reflects the truer essence of Sydney appeals to you â€“ book yourself a room immediately! For $190, this is probably the best value accommodation the city has to offer - and you'll walk away with an experience to remember, as opposed to a faded memory of yet another average, predictable hotel with a lack-lustre astmosphere. The rooms are located above the excellent pub, up some flights of stairs â€“ the staff will help carry your bags up. Our room was simple and spacious with stone walls and shuttered windows toiletries. The beds were very comfortable and spotlessly clean. The room was serviced daily, had quality bed linen and a range of toiletries. After a dayâ€™s sightseeing, we enjoyed ambling back to find a coveted spot in the busy, bustling bar to soak up the lively atmosphere reminiscent of a traditional English Country pub. We loved their Ploughmans Lunch (huge for $12), the beers and overall feel to the place. There is also a more upmarket bistro above the pub. Upon retiring to bed, we were amazed at how quiet the room was. The complimentary breakfast was great too and included real expresso coffee. My only suggestion for the Lord Nelson is to please put a hairdryer in the room. .. other than that, they have captured everything it takes for a warm, convenient, outstanding value and â€œfeel goodâ€� stay with a difference. The Lord Nelson Hotel is more than a place to sleep, it's a destination in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, good location and nice rooms with character.”
Reviews.Author: Jessb22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend, it is a great location, easy walking distance to circular quay and Pitt street mall. The room was clean and the stone walls added character. The pub serves good food and nice brews. Overall an excellent place to stay in Sydney, would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, lovely beer, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: BABSBINI
Reviews.Content: Went here for a few drinks, and was completely enamored by firstly, the ambiance, and then by the beers! I think its going to be up there along with Hotel Schwartz and Lowenbrau in ranking of my favorite beer-bars in Sydney, but will probably steal the thunder because of its ambiance. They brew a range of their own beers and serve some typically English pub grub. The beers are refreshing and a perfect accompaniment on a warm evening. However, the place is tiny, and you will be lucky to find a table inside, and even luckier to find one outside! This quaint little place has got all the qualities of typical small English pub. And the fact that its such a tiny place probably makes it even more appealing. The drinks are a bit expensive, but considering the atmosphere and ambiance, totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's oldest hotel”
Reviews.Author: SushNam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very nice area , right on the border of the old quarter and a 10 min downhill walk to the Quay and its amazing sea food restaurants and ofcourse the characteristic opera house. The rooms are cozy and have the basic amenities. There is no safe in the room and since the building is old the windows might rattle for a bit if its too windy. The staff is great and very helpful. There is a bar on the ground floor and they brew their own beer. It can get loud there but you wont hear a thing in your room.(There is another entrance to the hotel so you dont have to walk through the bar). The breakfast is okay and you can (sometimes) get free wi-fi but that's provided by some third party and may or may not work. If you have heavy suitcases then you might need the assistance of the staff to get your suitcases to your room as there is no lift. All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel in quaint neighborhood - great location for walkers”
Reviews.Author: SoReCa
Reviews.Content: Quaint accommodations - bedroom was very small, but very clean. Bathroom roomy and nicely appointed. Within walking distance of so many things in the CBD and a good choice for cruisers, as it's about 5-10 minutes walk to the Overseas Passengers Terminal. No noise from bar at night. Brew was fairly good, but it lacks body and is too thin, especially if you prefer typical English ales. Also, wait a few minutes before drinking, as the temperature is too cold. If visiting on a Monday, be sure to get the meat pie and peas special in the bar - great deal at $7 and very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “A better option than a big hotel chain”
Reviews.Author: PorkpieUk
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 3 night stay here, having found the hotel on Trip Advisor. I like drink or three so staying in a brewery seemed like a good idea. We booked via the hotels' own website with an email and decided to opt for an en suite room. We managed to find it using the street map we'd got and parked right outside the side door (you use one if you are coming or going outside opening hours) There aren't any lifts so just bear that in mind if you have a lots of / heavy luggage, there are a lot of stairs! The staff were very helpful both with checking in / out and with advice on the airport, places to visit etc... the bar staff and waiting staff were also friendly and polite. We had room 201 which has a partial view of the Harbour Bridge and is opposite the reception / office room. The location of the hotel means that there is some street noise, we found we had some unexpected early morning wake up calls but it wasn't a problem to drift back off to sleep. Our room was a good size and looked as though it may be used for meetings as it had some office type equipment and a really big table and chairs in there. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom had nice toiletries and a grooming kit. Shower pressure was good and hot water available all day. Breakfast was served in a separate room, lovely and light with nice flowers. Its a continental breakfast with a fruit plate, we found that its was plenty big enough to keep you going to lunch. Downstairs in the bar there is a great atmosphere, lovely beers and good food, what else can you want from your hotel? The bar was busy every night, a good sign, you need to time it right to get a table. We didn't get too much noise in the room however. Location is great, you can walk to the bridge in 10 mins and down to the harbour / Circular Quay in 10 mins (obviously depends how fit you are) so you are not far from any of the main sights and within easy reach of ferries to further flung places. You are also within reach of plenty of bars and restaurants. Its worth going into the smaller bars as some of big entertaining spaces out the back which are not always obvious from the front. Overall I think you get a better experience staying in a smaller place like Lord Nelson than you would do in a big hotel chain. Sydney is a big city and has a city vibe (for Oz standards anyway) but we were walking around at night and felt very safe. While we were in Sydney we went to the Aquarium which was good, took the ferry over to Manly which has a lovely beach, took the bus to Bondi (nicer than I expected) you get the #333 bus from Circular Quay, buy a ticket from the booth outside MacDonalds. We also walked over the Opera house but we didn't do any tours just explored the bits which are open.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: Aussimike
Reviews.Content: Staying at the rocks is great close to opera house and Harbour nice clean rooms at a good price we have stayed on two occasions and planning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MattDavies2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel for two nights just after New Year. Finding a place in Sydney had been challenging, with plenty of minimum stay requirements around that time and sky-high prices. Only 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay and at AUS$190 a night not as expensive as many other places around, I wasn't totally confident as we went up to the room - but it was really lovely and was very pleased with it for the last two days of our holiday. We didn't actually get chance to use the bar downstairs, as we were meeting friends elsewhere, but it looked good. Overall - friendly service, great room and value for money (in the Sydney context). Only slight gripe was the skylight in room with no curtain/blind, which meant room full of daylight waking me up earlier than I'd like to be awake on holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodations in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: 22explorer22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in this neat place. The location is fantastic, just about three blocks from Circular Quay. The few rooms are part (really a secondary part) to a bar and restaurant; its local clientele add ambiance to the experience. Although the rooms are small, old, and up steep stairs, we had no complaints (except we had trouble figuring out the cooling system). The staff (from the bar and restaurant) was nice and helpful. We wondered about the potential noise, but not a problem. Everything was clean, and the continental breakfast was adequate (although the limit of one cup of coffee seems a tad spartan). Overall, it was very nice to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem well worth discovering!”
Reviews.Author: TFandRacci
Reviews.Content: Fabulously located near The Rocks, this iconic Brewery and Hotel is known as Sydney's oldest hotel and is beautifully maintained. Within walking distance to the busy but beautiful Rocks area, Harbour Bridge, Observatory Hill Park, Circular Quay and another Sydney institution, the Hero of Waterloo. Not only were the pints of beer and cider welcomed after a bus ride from Canberra (must try 'Napoleon's Cider' and 'Nelsons Blood'!) but the food was absolutely divine, very reasonably priced and portion size perfect. The Roast Pumpkin, Beetroot and Feta Salad with added chicken was to die for and ordered again for dinner! The chorizo pizza was also fantastic and a good size to share after an entree of olives, bread and balsamic with oil. We requested a quiet room on booking and were given just that on the 3rd floor. (reasonable fitness required for the number of stairs but a good way to work off dinner!) Even though the pub was full for most of the day, we did not hear any noise from our room even with the windows open. Our room was gorgeous and cosy with window nooks and shutters, a very comfortable bed, great ensuite, tea/coffee making facilities, free wifi and just a lovely feeling about it. Breakfast was included in the tariff ($190/night) and was a continental one which was ample for what you needed to start your day....muesli, toast, fresh fruit and coffee and tea. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming which added to a much enjoyed stay. We only wish we had booked more than one night but would definitely recommend to anyone wishing to experience a beautiful part of Sydney history. We hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “A secret hideaway”
Reviews.Author: ronvoyage
Reviews.Content: The Lord Nelson Hotel and Brewery is located on the Rocks in Sydney. The location is ten stars by itself. The hotel is part of a facility that includes a bar and restaurant, the brewery, and a limited amount of hotel rooms. Since this was our second stay, we knew that room 201 included an ensuite bathroom and had lots of extra room. Room 202 is nice too, but not as large. Some of the rooms have shared bathrooms. This cozy inn has retained the original stone walls and that adds to the ambiance of the room 201. A continental breakfast is included. Do not miss half price meat pie night on Mondays and enjoy a pint of their famous brew. Reservations are a must, so use the hotel's website to book your room well in advance. New Year's Eve and the fireworks over the Sydney Bridge is a world class event and the Lord Nelson is in the perfect location to enjoy the experience. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect place in "The Rocks"”
Reviews.Author: Blacksandedd_11
Reviews.Content: The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel proved to be an ideal place for us to spend Dec. 23rd and Christmas Eve. 2011. It is located in the historic "Rocks" of Sydney, AU., and is within walking distance of Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, Chinatown, and most of the CBD. Registration takes place on the second floor where the restaurant is also located. The rooms are up yet another two levels. Our four bags were generously toted up the stairs (there is no lift) by two very willing young lads. We enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfasts both mornings. A cooked breakfast was available for purchase as well. On Christmas morning we were offered a complimentary glass of champagne, but since we were facing a long flight to Los Angeles, we declined. Our second story room was charming and comfortable, with exposed rock walls and shuttered windows that looked out over the street. There was a small refrigerator to keep our wine cool. We thoroughly enjoyed the pub on the street level, all though it was difficult to have a private conversation due to the volume of the general conversations of the wall to wall crowd of patrons. The staff in general was very friendly and most accommodating. We were a bit surprised at the price of two pints of their beer ($17.80 au), but it was conveniently added to our hotel bill. Since the Lord Nelson is located in a residential area, the pub closes around 11 pm. so getting to sleep in the rooms is not a problem. We would highly recommend the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel as a good alternative to the high priced high rise hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: RuairiH H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in total. Good location, 10 minutes walk to circular quay. As someone else said, if you dont like stairs dont stay here as the en suite rooms are on the 3rd floor. Breakfast is basic but filling, and all you need - cooked breakfast available if you wish. Pub downstairs always busy day and night, but closes around 10.30/11 so no issue with noise, and the pub is located in a residential area. Small things could improve it, like putting some bottled water in the rooms. Ordering food/drink had to be paid for at the bar, whether you were a hotel guest or not. Also was quite windy when we were there and as it is an older building the windows tended to rattle and be quite noisy at night, also the wooden blinds work to a point, but still expect the sun to wake you bright and early in the morning - for those who like to lie in. Staff friendly and helpful when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Centipede100
Reviews.Content: Don't choose this hotel if you don't like stairs, as there is no lift. However, on all other counts, I'd highly recommend it. The location is excellent, in walking distance of ferries at Central Quay and all the restaurants and bars at Darling Harbour.The room is small but comfortable, with much more character than chain hotels and the breakfast is good. Staff are friendly and helpful. We were worried about noise from the bar, but didn't hear it at all. We didn't eat in the restaurant on the first floor, but it looked good.

Reviews.Title: “Highlight of our trip to Australia”
Reviews.Author: callen2900
Reviews.Content: We thought this historic hotel was as much fun as anything we did on our entire trip. First, the "not so good": our room was very small and up three flights of stairs with no "lift". Everything else was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful in the office, the pub and the breakfast area. Location could not have been much more convenient to Sydney harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Somthing a bit unique in Old Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sirleeolgit
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying this is not an Hotel but a Pub that does Bed & Breakfast. non the less it operates to a high standard, the price including breakfast was less than any hotel I looked at in the area. The stairs to our room on the top floor got steeper each time i went up!!. We were able to leave our bags well before check in time and again after check out till we were ready to go to the Airport late afternoon. Our room was clean and well presented with a nice ensuite. The aircon that other reviewers mention was audible but not an issue. Breakfast was sufficent and well presented.A place of uique and real charm unlike chain hotels. It is in the heart of The Rocks district close to the Harbour Bridge. 15 mins walk in either direction will take you to Darling Harbour or Circular Quay and the ferries or train. A Bus leaves from accross the road that will take you to Circular Quay or Central Station and the CBD. The only down point is that at the end of a day of sightseeing and an evening of partying its uphill whichever way you approach, and then the stairs again!! so its neccesary to stop in the bar for a rest before that last climb.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, historic B&B”
Reviews.Author: TwoCrabs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel mainly from the Lonely Planet and TripAdvisor reviews, and also because we are huge beer fans. We were not disappointed. The hotel is a lovely B&B with small, cozy but comfortable rooms. The included breakfast was fantastic. The lovely young waitresses and the knowledgeable staff and bartenders were charming and friendly. And did I mention the beer? Fantastic! Would have loved to stay here for a few more days. If you're worried about any noise from the pub, it's not a concern. The bar closes promptly at 11pm (or earlier if the crowd has left), and there are two floors separating the bar and the hotel rooms. Those with mobility issues -- or lots of baggage -- should be aware that this hotel is a walk-up, and some rooms are located on the third floor (for Americans, that means the fourth floor). We highly recommend the Lord Nelson and would definitely come back here next time we are in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff in this unique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LandisD
Reviews.Content: Honestly when planning our trip to Australia I had a lot of trouble trying to find a hotel in Sydney. Rates in general were very expensive to stay in the Rocks/Circular Quay/Darling Harbour areas. Being a couple in our 20s we were trying to do our best to make the most out of our trip. Luckily we came across the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel. Making the reservation was a little unusual because it was done over email, but we didn't let that deter us. Our flight from New Zealand was a very early one and we arrived at the hotel at about 10 in the morning. Unfortunately our room wasn't available, but they were able to hold our bag for us until check-in time. On our way from Christchurch to Sydney the airline lost one of our bags. Apparently it didn't make the ride with us on the mostly empty plane. Just as a side note Jetstar is fine if you don't have any issues, but their customer service is almost non-existent. But for the hotels part they were absolutely fabulous. The staff was friendly and very concerned about our lost bag and did everything that they could for us to help us out. The room that we had was very large and had a dining room table as part of the decor. Our room was the first one up the stairs and right across from the check-in room. As others have mentioned the stairs can be a little difficult, but we've carried our bags on subways in lots of cities so this was not that bad for us. The free breakfast was excellent and filling. On the day we left we were in a bit of a rush to go to the airport and they packed up our lunch for us. The pub gets a little noisy at night, but our room was nice and peaceful. I don't know if it was just our room, but we couldn't find the hair dryer. Not a big deal, but just a thing to note. I'd highly recommend this historic hotel to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “To be part of the history”
Reviews.Author: GuaguaBeijing
Reviews.Content: We had double room on third floor of the hotel during our recent stay of 3 days in this hotel. This requires some efforts to take our luggage with us, but definitely worth it. On the room itself, what we liked most is the light and views. There is window in the bathroom allowing airing naturally. A window overlooking Darling habour, and a ceiling window to observe stars in the night. There is a side entry leading directly to the stairs, so no need to pass through the busy bar during evening hours. And once in our room, there is never noise from downstairs. We tried once the brasserie on first floor. The food was so good (fish and stead we've tried) and the house beer was fantastic. In one word, a wonderful stay in Sydney in this piece of history of the city. Apart from the circular guay which is just nearby, Sydney observatory is just 5 minutes walk away. We brought our daughter for the night stars observation tour, she enjoyed it so much. And the view from the hill was so nice. We forgot completely summer time change on the Sunday when we should leave. When we learnt the news from the staffs at breakfast, they were helpful enough to help us checknout in 2 minutes and called a taxi Asap... Which allowed us to catch our flight to Ayers Rock. We're truly grateful for this. But maybe next time, hotel could inform to it's guests, especially those who should check out on the days of time change before their departure.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Something Different!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: Great location - easily within walking distance of the Opera House and everything else we wanted to see while in Sydney. This place was so different from other places my husband and I have stayed at during our travels. The food and service (and beer of course!) was fantastic and best of all, you didn't have to go far after having a few pints. Room was clean, spacious and had an old-world charm. Brewery was the place to be and always a fun time. Great value - we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cpetemn
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed or stay, Rooms clean and spacious with comfortable beds. Staff friendly, pleasant and helpful.The Pub attached was lively and fun in the evenings and very popular with the locals. Closes reasonably early, so was no problem with noise at sleep time. The location couldn't be better. Just a very short walk to the Circular Quay and harbor. Some excellent restaurants very close and the hotel itself has an excellent restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner. Would gladly go back...

Reviews.Title: “Brew Pub and Flying Foxes....what could beat that?”
Reviews.Author: PirateKat
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 3 nights of a 7 week NZ/Tasmania/Sydney trip here. This is your place if you are not a chain hotel fan. For a great price you get an historical hotel, brew pub and the perfect base for exploring Sydney. We walked everywhere and looked forward to our pint at the end of the day. The room was unusual, but in a good way; there was a huge table and comfy bed. Each morning we breakfasted by a window watching the street activities. I had read reviews and was prepared for the stairs. Plenty of nearby restaurants, easy walk to the Harbour Bridge and don't miss the flying foxes at sunset in Observatory Park. They spend the day hanging out at the Royal Botanic Gardens. Next time we'll take the train from the airport and walk, now that we've mapped out a route that facilitates wheeling our unwieldily beasts (luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel full of Unique Charm & Character, Centrally Located in The Rocks with Easy Access to Most Attractions.”
Reviews.Author: LeChat_EnVacances
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel is located @ the corner of Kent & Argyle Streets. The airport train will take you to the city in 15 minutes & Circular Quay station is the nearest to the Hotel. Its central location in The Rocks gives you easy access to many places of interest: Sydney Observatory; Harbour Bridge; Opera House; shopping district around George & Castlereagh Streets; St.James Church & St.Mary's Cathedral; Hyde Park; Sydney Tower ~ most of which are within 10-20 minutes' walking distance. Darlinghurst & Paddington are further afield but are easily reached via buses or CityRail services & the journey is usually under 30 minutes. Harbour Cruises as well as ferries to Cockatoo Island, Darling Harbour, Manly & Parramatta River all depart from Circular Quay, a quick 10 minutes' stroll from the Hotel. The Rocks is Sydney's oldest neighbourhood, it used to be a slum for the working class & gangs once roamed its mean streets. Happily, all that has changed & it is now a colourful, vibrant precinct well-loved for its historic atmosphere & heritage sites. ROOMS: We were in 2 different rooms during our 7-night stay, both were clean & comfortable. If you are a light sleeper or easily disturbed by noise, you may wish to request for a quieter room on the 3rd floor as those on the 2nd floor will expose you to traffic noise & the rowdy merry-making of weekend revellers @ the Bar downstairs. The spacious 1st room was on the 3rd floor and was furnished with a double bed, 2 bedside tables & lamps, TV with multi-channels, a single bed, chair, luggage rack, a tall slender wall mirror, wardrobe with hangers & extra blanket, a cupboard with iron (ironing board is hidden under the bed), fax machine, mini-fridge as well as tea & coffee-making facilities. The slightly smaller 2nd room was on the 2nd floor and was similarly furnished except that it only had a double bed, its cupboard was much smaller & there was no luggage rack nor fax machine. BEDS: The double beds were huge & comfortable with clean sheets & plenty of pillows. The beds were made daily & the bed linen changed regularly during our stay. BATHROOMS: The 3rd floor room has ensuite facilities. The attached bathroom was spacious, clean & equipped with all necessary amenities: ample towels & toiletries (hand soap, shower gel, shampoo, body lotion, shower cap, cotton-buds, even a mini sewing kit). There was hot water supply (essential during winter) & the shower head had fairly good water pressure. The 2nd floor room had no ensuite facilities but there was a communal bathroom on the floor that seemed to be shared between 2-3 rooms only. During our 1-week stay, we found the communal bathroom to be in a decent state @ most times except for a few occasions when it was rather wet & untidy with used towels strewn upon the floor & vanity counter... Not a major issue if you can tolerate a little mess now & then. Ample bath & hand towels were provided in the rooms & replenished with fresh ones as required. F&B: Room rate is inclusive of daily Continental Breakfast, a simple but adequate offering: 2 slices of toasted bread, jam & butter, assorted cereals, seasonal mixed fruits, juices and the usual milk, coffee & tea. You can pay a little extra (about $16 AUD) for a cooked breakfast that includes eggs, mushrooms, grilled tomatoes, baked beans & bacon. The Lord Nelson Hotel has a Brewery & Brasserie on its premises. Its award-winning natural ales are brewed on site & its Bar Menu offers the usual fare of meat pies, fish & chips, pizzas, salads & potato wedges. We had pizza & risotto for dinner on our 1st night here & found the pub grub rather delicious despite the chef being over-zealous on the black pepper... The Brasserie on the 1st floor is apparently renowned for its â€œeclectic & innovative Australian cuisineâ€� but we did not have the chance to dine here so unable to comment. SERVICE: Operating Hours for Reception/Front Office (on the 2nd floor) seemed to be from 9am-5pm. Rebecca, the lady who attended to us was both efficient & warm, always ready with a friendly smile & greeting. Check-In & Check-Out both proceeded smoothly. Check-In Time is 1pm but if you arrive earlier, you can leave your luggage @ Reception & do a spot of sightseeing around The Rocks while waiting for your room to be ready. If you happen to arrive after 5pm, you can get the Bar Staff to assist you with Check-In. Check-Out Time is 10am but they kindly allowed us to leave our luggage @ Reception for rest of the day as our departure flight was @ 8pm. Breakfast Room usually has 1 service staff on duty so you may need to wait a little while for your toasts & coffee/tea to arrive @ the table but cereals, milk & juices are available @ the self-service counter so you can start off with these 1st. The Breakfast Staff who served us during our 1-week stay were all helpful & obliging. SUMMARY: The LORD NELSON is "Sydney's Oldest Licensed Hotel & also home to Australia's Oldest Pub Brewery". When you choose to stay here, you can expect an unique experience in a historic property full of charm & character. There are only 9 rooms here so do make your reservation early to avoid disappointment. The room rates are admittedly quite steep (AUD $130 for a double room with shared bathroom & $190 for one with ensuite facilities); you can of course find cheaper accommodation elsewhere in Sydney but you'd be hard-pressed to find one that could offer you a similar slice of history served with such hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent room and great food!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyinOz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel for 3 nights in March, It is ia lovely historic hotel not huge but in a great location in The Rocks away from the main drag but an easy walk to everything, including Circular Quay. We had a lovely attic style room - the bed was huge and really comfortable. It was really clean and quiet -considering we were above a hotel! After a day of sight seeing it was great to be able to drop off our stuff in our room and head back down to the bar to sample the hotel beers and a Ploughman's lunch or two. The staff were really friendly and the bar had a welcoming ambience with lots of locals eating and drinking there each night. The only downside was that there is no onsite parking but we found a local carpark within walking distance where we left our car for the three days , as we certainly didn't need it in Sydney. We will definitely go back and hubbie is happy as he found the Lord Nelson beers here in Melbourne.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Smartchoices
Reviews.Content: After a terrible few night elsewhere I entered the Lord Nelson hotel with some trepidation - to find Sydney best kept secret. A great hotel, sound proofing stopped any noise from the brewery down stairs. We had a lovely glimpsed of the harbour bridge from our spacious room. Cleaning and all other hotel staff obviously care. I should not tell you more or I might miss out on a booking when I want it. Fabulous location with large trees out the window, autumn leaves were falling...

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travels2101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Lord Nelson for four nights (Tuesday to Friday). Thought it was a great place to base our Sydney part of our NSW holiday. Rooms were clean and spacious, we had a share bathroom but never saw anyone else using it. The pub below can be a little noisy but they close at 11 so it did not disturb us much at all, and it was a great place to grab a tasty beer after a day out sight seeing before heading out for the night. The price included breakfast each morning wich mae it super good value. Would defenately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended - Great Location in The Rocks to explore City Centre”
Reviews.Author: QuickCar
Reviews.Content: We can't recommend this superb hotel enough. The room was spacious and the food available from the pub downstairs was excellent - especially on Pie Night. We had a real welcome from the staff and locals and found it a brilliant place to explore the city centre nearby and escape from it. Despite being above a pub in a busy area at nightime we had plenty of rest and weren't kept awake. There a local convenience shops nearby and we really felt like we were among the locals. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quaint but very busy bar in the evenings”
Reviews.Author: AnitWolko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in an ensuite room. The room itself is nothing to complain about but checking in was rather impersonal as you have to wait your turn at the bar which took an awful long time. We arrived quite late in the evening and were very tired after a long flight from Hongkong. If you want to eat in the bar you just have to be lucky. There are no extra advantages for staying guests. One thing I missed in the room was a hair dryer. My long hair takes ages to dry! The breakfast was very meagre, we never saw peanut butter or yoghurt which is mentioned on the continental breakfast menu. We did ask for more special things like cheese or bacon which wasn't charged extra by a very nice English girl who served us always with a smile! One word of warning: they have very expensive WiFi, we didn't bother and found our own solution which was much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully quaint and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: sarahoslp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lord Nelson during our honeymoon for 3 nights. We splurged for the ensuite bathroom which was well worth the money with a rather large tub (it fit 2!) The continental breakfast was fantastic and we found ourselves wishing we had it at the other hotels we stayed in around Australia. The staff was very friendly and the hotel is well maintained and clean. The bar downstairs is apparently the place to be as it was very crowded from 3pm-11 every day of the week. Although the Sydney bar scene appeared to frequent downstairs, we never heard noise in our room. The location is perfect, happily situated in the cutest of Sydney's neighborhoods called "The Rocks" and it's a very easy walk to the Opera House, Sydney Harbor Bridge and the subway station and ferry docks. We would happily stay here again if we return to Sydney. And a special thanks to Caroline, who greeted us with our "flat whites" and toast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “So much nicer than boring corporate hotels.”
Reviews.Author: Lizi1961
Reviews.Content: Despite being unable to check in early the bar manager was happy to store our luggage and give advice on where to go before check in time. Room was immaculate with enormous bed, flat screen TV and en-suite which was kept topped up with toiletries. Fridge ideal for keeping wine cool - useful as bar prices were pretty steep, but that could just be due to current exchange rate. Beer delicious but far too cold! Order it early and leave to warm up! Ideal position being only 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance, Poor and Expensive Internet Service”
Reviews.Author: FrontierAccountant
Reviews.Content: As an old, historic hotel with a pub on the main floor this was a great place to stay. The pub was always busy in the evening and had a nice casual atmosphere. The continental breakfast was interesting and of good quality. However, it was extremely frustrating to pay $20 (Aus.) for 24 hours of internet service and have it be tempermental. Besides periodially cutting out, the internet provider didn't seem to have an easy way of logging back in, charging me multiple times for the same day, a problem that I'll have to work out with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Great pub/hotel in easy walking distance to all the city highlights”
Reviews.Author: Tryping
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and comfortable room great food in the bar and good steaks in the restaurant and I love the beers brewed on site.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage hotel & those stairs...”
Reviews.Author: fergygrrl
Reviews.Content: Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel is one of those lovely heritage listed hotels that are known in Sydney but not so well known, it has become too popular, which has kept the appeal and attraction to visitors and tourists alike. Nestled on a corner about 5-10mins walk away from Circular Quay, it's surrounding tree's and shady areas bring a softness to the once hardened brewery and surrounds. We arrived @ 10am, too early for check-in but early enough to drop off our bags. We were greeted by the bar manager who was kindness it's self and poured us a glass of diet coke even though the bar was closed as we were so parched and hot. We finally checked in @ 1.30pm after visiting some of the sites around Circular Quay and were taken to our room on the top floor (4 flights later, but well worth the effort) - it was an extrememly hot day in Sydney and everywhere was sweltering but in the room it was like arctic ice, beautiful!! The room was clean, neat and very lovely...the bed was comfortable, the pillows were soft and fluffy and the sheets were clean. We stayed two days and our room was serviced to perfection the 2nd day as well, even to the point that our PJ's were folded neatly on our pillows! We were very impressed. Complimentary continental breakfast was included in the brassiere, which consisted of very fresh fruit, and lovely large rye or brown toast made to order. Fresh juice, good expensive cereals, yoghurt and tea or coffee and of course you could order from the menu of bacon and eggs etc (extra cost). And the staff, they were all lovely & very helpful - no complaints at all. We had a lovely stay at the Lord Nelson Brewery and will most definitely stay again if we visit Sydney...even with those flights of stairs....lol

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: LYDnBY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were leaving out of Sydney in mid-January on a cruise. We were leaving on a Saturday, and we got in on Friday, so we only stayed one night, but we would recommend this place, and would stay again for sure. We arrived before check-in, but they were very accomodating. We left our luggage in the office, and came back later for check-in. The room was nice. We booked an "en-suite" bathroom. There were no issues with noise at any point during the stay. It was very close (walking-distance) to dowtown Sydney (aka the bridge and opera house, oversease passenger terminal, etc). Breakfast was good, altho it is continental, so don't expect more than that. As others have mentioned, we did have to go get the girl from the restaurant to check us out, but it was not an issue at all. She did it very happily. Across the street there is a convenience store. We were able to buy some umbrellas there, since it was raining and we didn't pack any. The only downfall I would say were the stairs. We were leaving on a 2-week cruise, so we had a lot of luggage, and there were no elevators, AND we stayed on the 4th floor. So there was a lot of lugging up and down stairs. Other than that, I wish our stay was longer...It was a unique place to stay, close to everything, and you can't beat having fresh-brewed beer a couple flights of stairs below you!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good bar meals but Fawlty Towers breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: sandra_wright
Reviews.Content: A good experience overall but we did have some misgivings about this place. The way it is run seems to make it obvious that it is a pub / brasserie which offers accommodation as a sideline, which means that as a "hotel" guest you do feel like an inconvenience at times. The 2nd floor reception seemed to be closed much of the time so you need to find someone from the bar to help you need anything - which isn't always easy when they're busy - and breakfast in the bistro was a particularly unrelaxed affair (but more about that later). The rooms themselves are perfectly nice but some are better than others - we had to move rooms during our stay so we did stay in rooms on both floors 2 and 3, which are quite different. The 2nd floor rooms are really lovely, large and with exposed stone walls and bags of character; the 3rd floor rooms are plainer, smaller & hotter, and the 3rd floor landing always seemed to have drying bedding draped over the stair rail, which was a bit offputting. It was breakfast that stuck in our minds the most though. Apart from the fact that it ends at 9.30 prompt (and you will be reminded if you dally), which is early if you're on holiday and that the coffee is limited to one small cup, the service was so hilariously inept and erratic that my husband and I started to take bets on when the waitress would turn up and what items she would offer and then forget to bring on any given day! Day 1 started out not too badly. The waitress didn't give us a menu or tell us what was available but asked us if we wanted fruit and toast so we said yes and sat down. Then she returned about 5 minutes later and asked if we wanted drinks so we asked for tea and coffee. The food arrived and was very nice indeed, but as she served she informed us that we'd have to leave soon because breakfast finished at 9.30 (this was only 9.15 and a fair number of people were still arriving). On day 2 she asked us did we want breakfast (well, we were in the dining room at breakfast-time so this was a bit of a no-brainer) so we said yes and she suggested toast so we said yes and she immediately ran off to get it - so my husband ran after her to ask if we could also have fruit. As she scampered off after bringing the food we asked if we could have drinks and she looked surprised by the request but kindly agreed that we could. The peanut butter then needed 3 reminders before it finally arrived. She did bring us someone else's toast just as we were leaving though. On day 3 she offered drinks just as we were sitting down so we said yes, expecting her to come back and take our breakfast order but she didn't. When she brought the drinks we asked if we could have some food and she looked around as if surprised that we didn't have any but nicely asked what we would like and brought it. Except she forgot the fruit. And the peanut butter. On day 4 she ignored us for 15 minutes until we asked her if we could have breakfast, which seemed to surprise her a bit. We ordered one portion of toast and 2 of fruit, at which point she again dashed off before we had a chance to ask about drinks. When she brought our 2(?) portions of toast we leapt in to ask about drinks and she kindly agreed we could have some. After about 10 minutes we ate our toast (and peanut butter) because it was cold but the drinks still hadn't arrived so we got up to find her to remind her. Eventually they came but to be honest we'd gone off the idea by then and it was nearly half past nine anyway so we had a quick sip and left. I think a pad and pencil might have helped her a bit - or even just a short script to follow - or maybe a menu she could hand out??? The young lady was very pleasant but a waitress she was not. And it wasn't only us, all of the other guests seemed to have the same experience - everyone spent the entire time with confused and frustrated expressions on their faces. Maybe they were trying to get a complete breakfast on the table before the 9.30 curfew!! Joking aside, this is a nice place to stay. The location is excellent and the staff (when you can find them) are very friendly and helpful. The food in the bar is very good and although it did get extremely busy and noisy downstairs on Friday & Saturday evenings the noise didn't seem to reach the bedrooms. The management just need to pay a bit more attention to the accommodation side of things so that paying guests feel more welcome in their pub. And someone needs to get that poor girl a pad and pencil....................

Reviews.Title: “Historic Building”
Reviews.Author: k2iks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights prior to flying home following a cruise. The rooms are located at the two top levels of this historic building and there is no lift/elevator. However, they will carry you luggage for you. As we were on the top floor (four flights up) that was appreciated. Although it is a historic building it is air-conditioned which functioned fine. The bath was clean and modern. As for location it is in the Rocks area and walking distance to Circular Quay and the Opera House. Parking can be a problem as don't know if they have the facillities for such. Parking on the streets is available at a price of $4.40 per hour. We didn't have a car so no problem for us. To add to the charm of this place is the bar on the ground floor. which also serves bar food and they brew their own beer. The place seems to be very popular with locals.

Reviews.Title: “great quiet location; this is real deal”
Reviews.Author: breggie
Reviews.Content: authentic historic pub on first floor with good food and even better food in the restaurant on second floor. Rooms were quite nice, as long as you can share a bath without heartache. Staff courteous but not effusive as are most people in Aust. Great location for Circ. Quay and Tourist info HQ a mere 2 blocks away. Very quiet in room in spite of bar below.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms but felt we weren't very welcome”
Reviews.Author: Chuck1072
Reviews.Content: Recommend this place by the Opal Jeweller in town who said it was run by her friends- we arrived at 9pm and no one around to check in so had to disturb the bar staff to let us in - not made welcome at all- they didn't look up from the paperwork or tell us about the facilities or when breakfast was. The room we had was a double with ensuite - perfect dÃ©cor and lovely and spacious - no qualms about that. In the morning we were kept awake by the whole corridor using the bathroom banging the doors, chatting outside our room from 5am till 9am - slight disappointment. Breakfast was a really pretentious, long drawn out affair; the lady couldnâ€™t do more than one task at a time so made it quite a painful experience. Check out was by the owners, I presume, - had our backs to us - didnâ€™t communicate with us, ask us how was our stay - just printed out the invoice and that was it - no cheerful "good bye" or "thank you for staying with usâ€� Not sure why they are in the business of letting rooms - they have all the ground work done but donâ€™t want to go the extra mile to make guests feel valued and welcome. Weird!

Reviews.Title: “More pub than hotel”
Reviews.Author: BadgerMarty
Reviews.Content: While we really enjoyed out stay at the Lord Nelson, be advised that is not first and foremost a hotel. The staff works mainly in the pub or the restaurant, and the office is rarely open. They are very willing to help if you go to the pub or restaurant and find them, but this is an inconvenience. The room was very nice and the location was just about perfect. Breakfast was very good. The pub itself was by far the best I visited in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DRC56
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a business trip, looking for something 'different'. Found it here. Terrific, spacious and well-kept corner room on second floor with ensuite bath. Walls of sandstone, king bed, new carpet. Excellent location, a 10-min walk from Circular Quay RR stop (and wharf, Opera house, etc.). Pub itself is a delight with bears brewed on site. Food was quite good, and simple included breakfast with helpful staff adds to the overall value (paid $190/night). Pub closed 11 PM, so noise not an issue except street noise - but I always travel with earplugs. Fridge, iron, LCD TV. BTW, local friends were horrified at the thought of staying here as their memory of pubs in Sydney was from the 60's and 70's. The scene has changed!

Reviews.Title: “A real Gem”
Reviews.Author: Stevina
Reviews.Content: What more can you ask for - a hotel with its own micro brewery making real ales, this Brit was in real ale heavan when he stayed. The pub downstairs has a great atmosphere in the evenings and serves good quality pub grub. Rooms where great, walls with exposed stone etc, had a real cosy atmosphere, within walking distance of the central transport hub (curcular quay) and sydney bridge, we took some great "arty" shots around the base of the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: heartbeatoz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Cozy Hotel in a great location,lovely clean & comfortable Room on 2nd Floor no noise issues whatsoever, very comfy Bed as well, friendly helpful Staff to greet you on arrival . Great Character Hotel in a Fantastic Location close to Darling Harbour, The Rocks, Circular Quay and a Bus Stop across the Road. Delicious well priced Food and if you are there on a Monday try the Pie night Special. Also included is a Continental Breakfast of Cereal , Thick Slices of Toast , Coffee or Tea and a Fruit Plate enough to fill you up on your many walks around Sydney. The next time we are in Sydney we will be staying at this lovely little Gem again.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly an interesting, historic Site!”
Reviews.Author: BCMeev
Reviews.Content: We actually really enjoyed our stay at the Lord Nelson, once we got the luggage up the three flights of stairs! Note, no lifts here. It is a quaint, historic site with lots of character. Our room was comfortable (once they put the central air conditioning on). We were on the top floor with a king sized bed. Room was a good size with a lovely bathroom. From our hotel we were able to easily walk down to Circular Quay in about 10 minutes or so. As the Lord Nelson is in the Rocks, albeit on the edges, we certainly were able to take in all that that area had to offer with no problem. The Lord Nelson's Pub was a lot of fun and certainly a neighbourhood pub with lots of locals. In our 4 nights here, we certainly never had any issues with noise either from the pub or from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pub hotel very well located!”
Reviews.Author: Ultimick
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at this lovely pub though we were a little nervous on arrival at a full pub with two huge cases. The room we had was slightly small but it was well furnished. We were worried as we were being thrifty chosing the shared bathroom option but we were glad we did as we had no problems and the biggest bath ever! A slight downside for us was that it was primarly a pub and therefore felt the service side of things was a little less than we would have liked. The location was excellent and you could see everything from here. Our room was on a slightly noisy road but not as we feared from the pub but from the road as the windows were single glazed and therefore you could hear quite a lot (especially the buses from the station diagonally over the road). I would recommend this as its quirky and a lovely pub.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for something historical and different - this is it.”
Reviews.Author: flyok
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Lord Nelson and enjoyed our stay. We stay in Sydney all the time and often have a meal and a beer here. We decided to give the accommodation a try this time for a change and we weren't dissapointed. The first two nights we stayed in the corner room (202) and it was lovely. Quite roomy with ensuite, fridge, iron, tea making but no hairdryer. I borrowed one from the office - no problem. Then we had to move to a smaller room up on the third floor. It was very small and a bit of a let down after the bigger room, but still nice. There is no lift in this hotel, so if you have a lot of luggage as we did, you may want to look elsewhere. But for a weekend with miniumum bags, it's great. The continental breakfast is good and having the brasserie downstairs is a bonus. $7-50 for pie and mash on a Monday night - great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: SwedishGirl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lord Nelson for 6 evenings. The hotel is located in the Residential portion of the Rocks. We had a wonderful corner room on the third floor. The room and bath room were large and very clean. The staff were wonderfully helpful. We will definitely be staying at the Lord Nelson again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a truly boutique experience in an historic building”
Reviews.Author: statt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located to enjoy a big city without the hustle. The rooms have been very well updated while maintaining the old world ambience. We stayed with 2 other couples in ensuited rooms, and all three were excellent; although the corner room was probably the best. Breakfast in the very attractive restaurant was great. Service is a little quirky; this is a pub after all, but the staff could not have been more friendly. We were a little concerned about the noise but on our return at 1am it was blissfully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price if you share a bathroom”
Reviews.Author: ASonginmyHeart
Reviews.Content: The Lord Nelson is truly a little piece of Sydney's soul. Just a quick walk away from the action in the Rocks and Circular Quay, the location can't be beat! Plus, you have a world-class brewery at your feet! However, the ensuite price is a little steep. We chose to take our chances sharing a bathroom- saving $50/night. It was absolutely the right decision! The bathroom was right across the hall from our bedroom and we NEVER had to wait to use it. It was bascially the same thing as an ensuite room! We did enjoy the continental breakfast each morning, though it seemed to take a very long time to get service. In fact, the service is really the only downside to staying here. Reception doesn't open until 9:30 or later and they seemed reluctant to help with any information or advice about things to do in Sydney. The phone in our room was broken and they wouldn't even let us use their office phone to place a call about a tour booking. They also did nothing to fix the phone in our room and insinuated that we were just "using it wrong." You are better off to visit the I-Site on Argyle Road. However, the rooms and location can't be beat and the price is great if you're willing to share a bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CKF
Reviews.Content: My husband is a homebrewer, so we could not pass up the chance to stay at a brewpub while in Sydney. We really enjoyed our experience. The beer was good and the staff very friendly. Our ensuite room was very small but comfortable. I had read TripAdvisor reviews and was pleased that, as others found, we heard no noise from the bar crowd in our third-floor room. Really! Very accurate reports about the continental breakfast--it was just okay. And remember there is no elevator, so you will carry your bags upstairs. The hotel is within walking distance of the bridge, Circular Quay and ferries, Opera House, and botanical gardens--great location. Probably a little overpriced, as we paid the same amount for an opera view room at the Four Seasons! But overall a nice place. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and quaint”
Reviews.Author: cinedra
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the bar-pub location and situated directly in the rocks close to opera house and harbor bridge. Good service, quiet, nice accomodations for those who do not need / want all the extras of a large hotel. About the same price though. Had a stand alone bathroom in our room which was nice. Continental breakfast was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cozy”
Reviews.Author: vagabondodelmondo
Reviews.Content: We're in our top floor room at the Lord Nelson at this moment and it's lovely--an attic room with two dormer windows with window seats and a view of the glittering water and Darling Harbor beyond. Had a delicious (but pricey--$89 for two) gourmet dinner at the Brasserie restaurant (upstairs from the pub). The room is very clean, cozy and my daughter is soaking in the deep tub in the also very clean bathroom. The immediate neighborhood is quiet but a few blocks away are many stores, restaurants and clubs. We arrived this morning--took the easy-to-find train to the Circular Quay station, walked the dozen blocks to the Lord Nelson dragging our roll-aways. We were too early for check in, so they held our bags while we walked to the Sydney Bridge, the Opera House and back to the Circular Quay to take the ferry to the Aquarium. We took a taxi back to the hotel, but I can see from my window that we could easily have walked back. Oh, and there are unexpected extras in the room--a fax and a refrigerator and we asked for a hair dryer. People are nice, room is nice, location is perfect, we're very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: JourneymanColorado
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and really loved the location, the rooms, and the pub. We were on the second floor and it was a perfect place to be; quiet, clean and a great part of history. We stayed in an ensuite room which was fantastic, spacious and very nice. The area that the hotel is located is the historic area, we could even see the Harbour Bridge easily from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: HavHun65
Reviews.Content: It's one of the nicer places we stayed in Sydney and great value for money! The location was fantastic and our room had a view of the Harbour Bridge! We could walk to the harbour in under 10 minutes. Breakfast was really nice and our room was huge! Warning there is no lift, so pack light as the rooms are on the 2nd floor up! Such good value, that I am treating my parents to a night there on their trip to Sydney in May.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gulf-coast-walter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and loved all of it. The location to Circular Quay and the rocks is perfect. The room we had was a shared bathroom but it was never an issue. For beer lovers, the Lord Nelson has a nice array of offerings. For those looking for decent food, you can try the meat pie with mashed peas. On weeknights the pub closes at 10 or 11(?), so noise was never an issue. If I return to Sydney for a third time, this is my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: seattlehilda
Reviews.Content: What a fun place to stay. As first-timers to Australia, this was a perfect landing spot in Sydney. Excellent location in the Rocks - touristy, but historic, lively, and near attractions and public transportation. Congenial staff, friendly atmosphere. Nice selection of beer in the pub. The bar was busy every night but we couldn't hear noise upstairs. We had room 203 - a shared bath that worked out fine. We peeked at room 204 next door and agree that it would be small for a couple. We're happy we found this spot through the TripAdvisor recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolyne1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2010 on our first trip to Austrailia. We stayed at The Lord Nelson for 6 nights and found it the perfect holiday hotel. Yes, there is the very busy bar downstairs but the hotel rooms are two floors up so we never had any problems with the noise. There is also a very good bistro on the second floor although we never got around to having a meal in the bistro. This is a very clean and well kept hotel and the staff are very friendly and always wiling to offer advice. This hotel is ideally situated for discovering "the rocks" part of sydney which is full of the older colonial houses and not much chrome and highrise in sight (thank god!). The only times we left "the rocks" was to take a trip to the blue mountains or when we climbed the sydney harbour bridge (thoroughly recommended even if you are afraid of heights like I am). We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please refuse to take room 204.”
Reviews.Author: Englisholdies
Reviews.Content: The wonderful reviews on T.A. plus the obvious quirkiness of the establishment led us to the Lord Nelson. We absolutely agree it's in a great location, clean, brilliant hugely popular pub. The best meal I had in 40 days away was their rack of lamb. Yummy. BUT two people in room 204 was SO uncomfortable. The shared bathroom was no problem but the poor use of space in the tiny room made it very frustrating. Why take up the space of 2 shelves with a fax machine? Why have a folding picnic table and a silly little circular table when you could utitlise that space with a solid topped drawer/desk top unit? The bed is pushed against the window with a few centimetres at the bottom so you have to climb over your partner to get out!! It would be ideal for a single traveller. We had to leave our second suitcase in their office as there was no way you could get it in the room. Sadly it poured with rain for 2 1/2 of our three days there. Drying damp shoes and jackets was a challenge! We did get a peep in one of the other rooms and couldn't believe the difference. So our advice would be, pay the difference and get an ensuite room, especially if you have a cat that needs swinging! We are not hard to please (see our other reviews) but it would be unfair not to warn others against room 204 unless you are travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: bauwens
Reviews.Content: We were given the room on the second floor right above the door, in the center corner. Room was spacious. Air conditioning was very silent compared with most hotels. This to us ended up being more important than the bit of noise coming from the pub sidewalk downstairs, even though we were there on a Saturday night when presumably the pub is at its busiest. Anyway, we slept fine and it's the birds that woke us up in the morning. True that breakfast is a bit odd, they don't really tell you what they have, you need to ask; almost sounds as if they try to minimize what you ask for in a clumsy manner. But eh, we were happy to get an expresso and sometyhing to eat included in our room rate. Last time we were in Sydney we paid about the same for a miserable place close to the central train station and with no breakfast. No comparison. Of course, the other plus is location. Incidentally, the restaurant has a nice wine list. Room a bit noisy, but I guess that's what old stones does to you? Anyway, next time we go through Sydney, maybe we'll stay for a couple of nights for a change and we'll return to this place. Quite lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & loved the beer!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_biker_1
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the "Lord" The location was handy for the variety of touristy type things we were interested in. Also the beer was outstanding! Would stay there again. One note - we arrived direct from the airport at 11:55am, and the doors do not open until noon - a moment of panic while we are locked out on the sidewalk with our luggage. Someone heard us and came down to let us in. Make certain they are aware of your arrival time if you will be there before noon. We assumed that we wouldn't be able to get into our room yet, but hadn't counted on not getting in the building :-) The continential breakfast was great, lunch was outstanding and I mentioned the beer. I will say that the staff was uneven as far as level of helpfulness, some very much so and others seemed put out by a request. Overall tho we would recommend and stay again, if nothing else we haven't had a chance to sample all the varieties of beer they brew!

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hollylove
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel suited in an excellent location. It can be easy to get many pubs, great shopping, Darling harbour, circular quay, the Harbour bridge, and the Opera house by walking. Clean room, comfortable bed, fully equipped, lovely decorated Although there is a pub, but it is closed at about 10pm so it is very quite and no noise at all. The beer is also excellent, I and my friends loved getting in the pub in the evening, drinking a cup of beer and having a chat, it was great

Reviews.Title: “Location and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: JohnHMapleValley_WA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lord Nelson after reading other TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. While not a bargain in the scope of Sydney hotels, the Lord Nelson delivers by being in the best spot in Sydney. Close to The Rocks (5 min walk), not far from the bridge, Circular Quay, the Aquarium, or the rest of downtown, Lord Nelson is in a perfect place. The rooms were immaculate, quirky with the blocks of hand-hewn sandstone all around you, but well equipped. We had ensuite bath that was modern and well equipped (a huge tub!). The pub is on the ground floor and is almost always quite crowded, so getting a liter or a plate is tough unless you go early. Take a few minutes out in the morning and go talk to the brewmaster-- he was great to talk to, full of interesting information. We only ate breakfast (included) in the Brasserie upstairs, but prices looked high-end-- we instead walked to The Rocks and ate there. Don't miss the Royal Observatory on the hill across from the Hotel-- an uphill walk, but loads of information!.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but noisy”
Reviews.Author: TamaTareco
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, some of them with a good view. The bathrooms are large and well equipped. Complimentary tea and coffee in room. Good location, as you are in only a few walking minutes from the circular quay and opera house. Small yet good breakfast. The only problem is the noise at night. We "enjoyed" loud music on both nights till as late as 2am.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic Sydey Experience”
Reviews.Author: fiafia
Reviews.Content: Staying in the oldest hotel in Sydney, with a lively pub thrown in on the ground floor as an extra, is a classic experience. I travel to Sydney 4-6 times per year from the USA, and this has become my "home away from home". The hand cut sandstone walls and the modernized en suite baths are wonderful. Maid service is dependable and professional. The in-room fax machine is a quirky touch! The breakfasts, both the complimentary continental and those that can be ordered off teh menu, are good, and the dinners are aslo fine--although I prefer the "pub grub" served downstairs with the local regulars. The neighborhood is convenient to the tourist attractions of the Rocks and the Harbour Bridge, and it is a 2 minute walk to the bus stop and the connecting train to the airport. For those that are looking for a unique, off the tourist path spot in Sydney, the Lord Nelson poster says it all: "You've been praying...The Lord has Delivered"

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: trvlr888
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here and enjoyed our time very much. Pros: - Excellent location. This hotel is near The Rocks but still far enough away from the tourist buzz to feel quiet and local. It's near a park and a beautiful old church. - Quiet. We were concerned about noise since the pub on the bottom floor is very popular and open until 11pm. However, the rooms are all 2-3 floors above the pub (there's a restaurant on the first floor above it) and are very quiet. - Our room wasn't huge but it was very comfortable. - The pub was excellent; we had drinks and dinner there one night. - The fun factor of staying in a pub (if you're from countries, like we are, where pubs are uncommon). Cons: - $190 AUD/night (for a room with an ensuite bath) seemed a bit steep considering that many of the big brand hotels in the area were priced in the $200-$250 range and come with full facilities (internet, concierge, etc). Overall, though, we'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location to walk to attractions”
Reviews.Author: nursenancyTennessee
Reviews.Content: The Rocks location is perfect for touring Sydney and surrounds without renting a car. The hotel has generous sized rooms and was quiet, as the pub closes before midnight. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pub food was generous, well priced and good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ral338
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value given how close it is to central Sydney. You can walk to Circular Quay (under 10 minutes) although it's an easier walk to CQ than from since that way is downhill. Several local buses that run down George St. originate/terminate across the street - the location is called Millers Point. A taxi from Circular Quay (since I had luggage) cost 8 Australian Dollars, although it's not a great distance (but uphill). You'd think a hotel over a pub would have a noise problem - but since the rooms are two floors above the pub you don't hear anything. It's all stairs though - no elevator. The area is mostly residential, but the Rocks district with plenty of restaurants is less than a ten minute walk away. The room was fairly sized, with a full size bed. However there wasn't much drawer space, just the desk. There is a decent closet. The room also had a refrigerator, and coffee maker. Bathroom was satisfactory, temperature and water pressure in the shower were good. The rate included breakfast, served in the second floor restaurant. This was cold cereal, a fruit plate, toast, plus coffee or tea. Hot items can be purchased. Not spectacular, but a satisfactory way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best Balance of Location and Cost for Tourists in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mistadobalina
Reviews.Content: We figured we wouldn't spend any time at our hotel in Sydney - we were right. We also figured that since we wouldn't spend any time at the hotel, this place would be perfect in terms of price for the location - we were right on this as well. It's a short walk to Circular Quay, a medium walk to Darling Harbour, and right in the middle of the Rocks. Our room had all we needed - a comfy bed and a bathroom. It also had the unexpected benefits of a big-screen TV and a refrigerator. Really, there's not much more to say - excellent location, good price, no frills. There's a little more about the room and the location in our trip report - http://www.justinandcrystal.com/Australia/index.htm

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: JackieBrizVegas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lord Nelson. Initially I was apprehensive and almost didn't book as I thought the rooms may be old and grungy and the noise of the bar would travel to our rooms. But we did book and are so glad we did. It was fantastic. We paid a little extra and got the room with the ensuite (room 202 - lovely corner room). The room was tastefully appointed, fresh, clean, great shower and the noise from the bar didn't bother us at all. The Lord Nelson is located in a fantastic spot, walking distance to the circular quay, bridge climb, all through the rocks, even stroll into town. Breakfast is included but the contential breakfast is light-on. Would definetly recommend !!

Reviews.Title: “great deal”
Reviews.Author: h2ofall2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in October, good location, Room 202 was perfect, location was no problem, 5 minute walk to the main Rocks district, 10 minutes to Circular Quay. Noise was never a problem, at 10 o'clock the Pub was quiet. The beer in the pub was some of the best I had in 17 days in Australia, I would definitely tell friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: redchristie
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for a whistlet stop in Syndey and had a lovely stay. Room was lovely and big, well funished and homey. Staff were friendly but might be confused as indifferent as they are so laid back. THey were really flexible with us and catered to our every need. The Pub downstairs is very cosy and busy although the noise never distrubed us. THe hotel is in a great location and is excellent value for money, especailly in a heavy tourist area like Sydney. WE would both recommend this hotel to anyone on a short visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: UKRob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. It's a perfect base for exploring Sydney. We had an en-suite room which was spacious and clean. The staff at breakfast were particularly pleasant and helpful. I looked at several hotels and B&Bs before booking this one. For the price and location I think you'll struggle to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place”
Reviews.Author: NWTravelerz
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel. Since we're beer drinkers, it was great to come back to your hotel after a long day sightseeing and have a great pub right there. Their meat pies were phenomenal---I think the special was on Monday nights. Overall, it was a quiet, clean room although be prepared to share a bathroom. (You can choose rooms that have private bathrooms as well.) The view from our room was spectacular as well, overlooking one of the bridges and we saw the sunset every night. It was also a quick walk to the Rocks and the Harbor. We'd definitely stay here again if we're back in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; Indifferent Innkeeper”
Reviews.Author: Ijua
