Reviews.Content: Situated above the bustle of the Rocks business district, but in easy walking distance to many of Sydney's attractions, the Lord Nelson Hotel/Bar/Brassiere is housed in a smartly renovated XIX-century stone building. We stayed there twice on our holiday to Australia and would stay there again. The rooms were clean and comfortably furnished. The rates, for Sydney, quite reasonable, the continental breakfast standard. The ground level of the hotel is a brew-pub, and sells excellent beer and decent food. We did not eat at the brassiere, but the menu looked good and priced on-par with other restaurants with similar fare. A couple downsides: The innkeepers were quite indifferent towards us, and minor requests were met with a sigh and a shrug. The building doesn't have an elevator, and lugging our bags up to the four flights of steep stairs was a wee-bit of a challenge. Rooms 204 was an Abu-Ghraib sized cell. (We were confined there during one of our visits.) On Saturday night, the bar crowd was a bit rowdy and woke us.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca019
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our 3 nights here. The hotel is in a leafy part of the Rocks only a short walk (10 mins) from circular quay. Our room was huge and very comfortable, we had en-suite which was a spacious bathroom with shower, very clean. The noise from outside did carry into the room as the windows are only single panes, it wasn't a big problem for us but understandably others may find it a reason to grumble. Continental breakfast was included which was enough for us, others may want more which will come at an added price. Staff were friendly and approachable. A really nice building mixing old and new, if you don't end up staying here I'd recommend the bar area for a pint, it had a very rustic original feel and each night had a steady buzz of locals....always a good sign!

Reviews.Title: “Great colonial-style hotel near The Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Todd_Whitehurst
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We stayed in room 303, on the top floor (no elevator!). The ground floor is the pub, the first floor (one story above the ground) is a restaurant and also has the hotel office, and the second and third floors are hotel rooms. Since we were staying on the top floor in room 303, we had to climb 3 flights of stairs to get to our room. The room was nice. It had a small TV in it that picked up a few channels. It had a double bed and also a single bed in it, so it was relatively large. It had a decent view of Darling Harbour nearby. It was very clean, with decor that was decent but not fancy. The bathroom was very clean and very nice. The room included a continental breakfast in the nice restaurant (brasserie) on the first floor (one story above the ground, i.e., one floor above the bar). The restaurant seemed bright and sunny in the morning. The wireless Internet service worked well, but I recall that it was rather expensive. A post office is across the street, and a small market is nearby. It is just 3-4 blocks from the restaurants and shops in the Rocks. When the wind kicked up early in the morning (around sunrise), the windows rattled a bit, which was slightly annoying. Additionally, we could smell the smoke from a nearby fireplace at one point in the evening, although it was pretty mild.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of Historic Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TrnrMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Lord Nelson's at the end of March 2009 and had a comfortable stay. A pluse is the location, although it is not right in the heart of The Rocks area. The rooms are large, and the hotel has a lot of historic character, but has been remodeled with air, TV, internet, etc. The pub brews several interesting beers, and the pub food served was excellent (but only served during certain hours). Minuses that might be important to some: the walk from George St. is moderately uphill, no elevator , minimal continental breakfast, and noise from the pub (which doesn't last past 10 PM or so on Friday/Saturday night. The bathroom tile & grout also could have used a thorough scrub, being a bit dingy and in one corner, moldy & cracked. Overall, however, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting for Visit of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WFT10S
Reviews.Content: My first night at the Lord Nelson (a Saturday night when a large group was in the bar) wasn't the best. There was considerable street noise until 3:30 am. -- ugh! I was sure my wife would want to move out and I was ready to acquiese. But, surprise, she said it would get better -- and it did! The location was excellent for getting to the Rocks area. The room itself was large, the building historic and the beer excellent. We ended up having two meals in the bar and one in the restaurant. All were good. The Lord is a destination and people were coming in groups of 7 even in a downpour. All in all, a great location from which tour the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in tourist centre”
Reviews.Author: Nottles
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with very comfortable and roomy bedroom. There is a restaurant but we ate in the bar each evening. The food was tasty and the beer was very drinkable (not the usual cold lager). The hotel was a 5 minute walk from Central Quays and the ferries. It is very accessible to the tourist parts of Sydney. We arrived early but there was no problem in leaving our cases. We were lucky that one of the barmen carried our cases up the stairs but as we were on the fourth floor and there is no lift we anticipate this could be difficult for some.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location”
Reviews.Author: ktfrostie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Sydney and had a wonderful time at the Lord Nelson. We had a second floor room, but didn't hear the bar noise at all, even on the Saturday we were there. The street noise can be a bit loud early in the a.m (buses/morning delivery trucks, etc.) but who wants to sleep in when in such a great location? I am not sure if it only for a limited time, but Monday night is $6 beef pie night- a sizeable beef pie with peas and mashed potatoes. Washed down with a pint of their brew, and its a great (inexpensive!) dinner!

Reviews.Title: “More Praises for Lord Nelson Brewery”
Reviews.Author: kittytraveltweets
Reviews.Content: Not sure how much more I can rave about this place that hasn't already been said. The brewery has great character and loads of history as you would expect from a place that has been around since the 1800s. You have to go through the Pub to get to the rooms upstairs. Yes, there are no elevators but someone at the bar helped us with our bags. I felt sorry for him since we had 8 bottles of wine in our bags. While walking up the stairs you can only imagine what it was like way back in the 1800s. The actual pub itself is not fancy but the rooms and the floors they are located on are very elegant and modern. Although, the buildings is old the rooms have been updated with central air, recess lighting, and granite countertops. A free continental breakfast was served on the Mezzanine floor in their restaurant. The restaurant again was elegant and modern and the breakfast was a fine way to start the day. I was a little worry about the pub noise but it was not a problem. Also, you're staying in a pub so you got to have a beer. I wished we spent more time in Sydney so I can just stay at the Lord Nelson Brewery longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TarragindiTripper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2008 for two nights. Great historic location at the Rocks. Lots of restaurants, pubs, and market stalls around. 5-10 minute walk to the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, and Circular Quay train station. The hotel itself is a lively pub, but we couldn't hear the noise from our room. We could hear a vent outside our window, but it didn't bother us once we closed the bathroom door. Typical pub fare downstairs (and lots of good beer), and a decent-looking restaurant upstairs (but we didn't go there for dinner). The airport train is a cheap and easy way to get to the hotel - unless you have tonnes of luggage, then you might want to organise a shuttle bus. And if you do have tonnes of luggage, bear it in mind that there's no elevator and you might be on the fourth floor, like we were. Staff weren't particularly warm, but they weren't rude. Because they also work in the pub there's no one waiting at reception all the time - you might have to go find them. So I wouldn't recommend being in too much of a hurry when you're checking out. While the free continental breakfast was lovely, we wanted to upgrade to a cooked breakfast on our second morning. You can't just pay the extra; you have to pay the full amount. So my husband did, and it was also very good. Our ensuite room was clean and had everything we needed. The bed was a bit lumpy, but the bath in our room was nice and deep.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: livin2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel for in November. I had the corner room above the main entry to the brewery with ensuite bath. The room was spacious, comfortable, and clean. The continental breakfast was as advertised with cooked items available at additional cost. The location in the rocks makes it a relatively easy walk to the big visitor attractions. Sydney is very touristy and the Lord Nelson gets you access to all that for a reasonable price, particularly when compared to the other hotels that are nearby. We always spend significant time walking when we travel to help give us a good feeling about an area. We felt comfortable walking all around the area. There are no elevators at the Lord Nelson which can be an issue if you do not pack light. I found that many of the places we stayed in Australia did not have adequate noise proofing. Street sounds were a bother at most of the places we stayed unless we were outside the city. The Lord Nelson suffered from the same problem. The sounds of the pub were never an issue since it closed before we went to sleep. Street noises from trash collection, street sweepers, etc. would wake you up unless you did something about it. We had ear plugs that we had used on the flight over to help us sleep on the plane and we used them every night to cut the street sounds. While that sounds like a bad thing, it was a simple solution. All things considered it was a pleasant stay and a good value. I would stay here again and recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good visit, will be staying at the Lord Nelson again”
Reviews.Author: kaybee751
Reviews.Content: My experience was pretty much on par with the other reviewer's at this site: it's a great location, convenient walk from Circular Quay and Darling Harbour, with a major bus stop less than 1 block away. The room was clean, well-equipped and quiet (though I don't know where the "60 channels" comes from, I had about 10X less than that on my TV! Not that I cared). Check in at 1 PM, check out at 11 AM. They were able to store my bags securely in their office before check-in & after check-out as well. Being a very old building, of course there was no elevator but the staff helped me carry my luggage up to my room on the 3rd floor. The beer was the best that I had in my entire Australia visit, and the food was good in both the pub and the restaurant. The "Continental" breakfast featured a variety of cereals, youghurt, and choice of breads (brought to you toasted from the kitchen, along with your fruit plate) and coffee/tea. My only two pieces of warning: my room had a skylight that didn't have a shade - so when the sun comes up at 4 AM, the room gets bright pretty fast. Also, the bathroom to my room was right across from the AC fans for the building, so I had a constant hum from the fans, even with the bathroom window & door closed. Mind you, I'll take "constant fan hum" over "street noise" any day. I loved my stay at the Lord Nelson, and hope to be able to stay there again on my next visit to Sydney. Sure glad I had a friend familiar with Sydney who helped me find the Lord Nelson!

Reviews.Title: “Praise for the Lord”
Reviews.Author: DavidJK
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights in the Lord Nelson on a quick visit to Sydney. The location, as other reviewers point out, is right in the middle of a fabulous part of the city. We were able to stroll to many shops and restaurants, as well as to the Circular Quay ferry wharves and the steps up to the Harbour Bridge walking path. Leaving Sydney, we easily could have rolled our luggage to the Circular Quay rail station, but we hopped in a passing taxi that took us there for about AU$6. Our room (302) was cozy and comfortable. Furnishings were stylish and tasteful. The bathroom was large, clean, and well lit. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've every had in a hotel. It was convenient to have an iron and a mini refrigerator. The corner room gave us views of the Sydney skyline and the Harbour Bridge. We did hear a bit of sporadic street noise, but the area is largely residential and quiets down at night. The continental breakfast was modest, and perhaps was the single disappointment to our stay. Offerings were limited to cereal, fruit, juice, toast, and one cup of coffee, so it seems that we could have expected more from this high quality establishment. Cooked breakfast was available at extra cost. The Lord Nelson is an excellent choice for guests who don't need to be in the city center or require a full service hotel. The staff seems to work mostly in the ground floor pub and the first floor restaurant. The bar workers are invariably friendly and will attend to hotel guests, but they are not fully prepared to see to lodging business. Also, potential guests should be aware that the rooms are on the second and third floors of the building. There is no elevator, so all luggage and guests must go up and down the stairs. The bottom line is clear. We enjoyed our stay at the Lord Nelson, and we will look to stay again on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: esdm
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a cosy area! Walking distance to Circular Quey and the city! (There is also a bus stop close to the hotell) The beer tastes fantastic and the pub meny is also great food. The breakfast was although a little poor, with only white bread and cerials.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location”
Reviews.Author: UsaPassportStamper
Reviews.Content: The Lord Nelson is located in the edge of the Rocks district, a short walk from great pubs, great shopping, and circular quay, the Harbor Bridge, and the Opera House. Spotless room, well equipped, well decorated, 60 channels of TV, a fax machine?!. Nice place. Quiet, the Pub closes at 10pm, so no noise at all. Great beer!! Although 7.50 a pint, ouch!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, great beer”
Reviews.Author: mridolfo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Nelson for 6 nights, including New Year's Eve. The main reason for choosing this hotel was that it is so convenient for seeing Sydney on foot. It takes a little over 5 minutes to reach the heart of the Rocks and 10-15 minutes to reach Circular Quay. Our room - the much-maligned 304 - was much better than we had been led to believe by other TripAdvisor contributors. The so-called 'noise' is easily blocked out by closing the bathroom door and there is good air conditioning. However, you do need to be fairly fit to get up and down the stairs (no lift), particularly with heavy bags. It is important to note that this is not a hotel in the strict sense of the word, so don't expect staff to be around at your beckon call. It took us a while both to check in and check out, and the 'welcome' from staff varied from genuinely friendly to grumpy / disinterested. The continental breakfast was fine, and you can pay extra for cooked, if you want. A bit of a disappointment when we were there was that the brasserie was closed. It was not clear if this was an ongoing situation or whether it was the time of the year. Also, for three nights over the New Year period, there was a limited bar menu. For New Year's Eve itself, it was a fantastic location. Only around 50 metres up the road is one of the best locations for seeing the midnight fireworks. Be aware though, we did have to pay a premium to stay New Year's Eve. M & H, Bournemouth, UK

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: aussierover
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this historic pub for 2 nights while on a short break. Our ensuite room on the top floor was clean and on the bigger side compared to some of the other rooms mentioned in reviews..king size bed with a single bed. Bathroom was a little cramped with the toilet having little room between it and the bath/shower entrance..also no fan in the bathroom which was a slightly odd for an internal room. Usual bar fridge ,tea and coffee facilities provided plus fax machine, iron but no hairdryer! There were 2 quaint little windows with wooden slat shutters...went to open them at 0700 to be confronted by a painter painting the woodwork..not sure who got the biggest shock!! Breakfast was quite adequate..help yourself to cereal and fruit juice, with toast tea coffee and a lovely plate of fresh fruit for us each served to our table. Just felt a bit rushed as everything came while we were still eating the cereal. The stairs may be a problem if you have heavy luggage or are unfit, but the area is quiet and historic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- good value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotters92
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect place to stay while visiting Sydney. It is fairly close the proximity of the Circular Quay (around 10 minute walk). The breakfast that is included with the room is very nice. Rooms were kept very clean, and the area is a nice, safe area. Plus the brewery downstairs is excellent! The only minor complaint are the stairs. No elevator for your big bags, but the hotel is very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Lord Nelson - Lord of Real Ale.”
Reviews.Author: davebarker
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much the closest that you'll get to a 'pub' in sydney. For $7 a pint you get a pretty good locally brewed ale, in a variety of shades. Definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Mary1955
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my brother in March - loved the location, the bar and the restaurant (great food). Would stay here again but our room was very small.We booked a twin room and the room we were given would have made an adequate single into which they'd obviously inserted an extra bed. It had a cupboard but no drawers that we could find and we had to keep one of our suitcases in the bathroom because of lack of floor space! When we complained the only response was a "sorry, we're fully booked".If you stay here make sure you get a room on the second floor (they're lovely) and not the third.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcsmith07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our two-week honeymoon to Australia. We booked this hotel mostly because it seemed to be a great price and we liked the historic/pub aspect, and our expectations were exceeded. We had a beautiful corner room with three windows (plus another in the bathroom). The bathroom was spacious and nicely renovated, with granite counters and a fantastic shower, and the linens on the bed were perfect. Yes, we had to carry our suitcases up 3 flights of stairs, but that seemed like a small inconvenience for a hotel this nice, at such a great price in a perfect location in Sydney. It was a short walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House, so we loved the location. We would definitely recommend this hotel and/or stay there again. It is probably not ideal, however, for business travelers or people with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: TracyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first two nights of a month-long trip to Australia, and liked it so much that we came back at the end of the stay for an additional 3 nights. Yes, it is hard to lug suitcases up the stairs, but the bar staff will usually do it for you when you arrive. The rooms are smallish, with spartan but pleasant decor and are very functional and neat. We loved the room fridge for our snacks and lunch items! The rooms are quiet, despite the bar below. However, on our return stay there was a reunion party one night in the restaurant below our room and it was very noisy. We were told that parties would be common through the holiday season, so be advised and bring earplugs if you travel during that time! The pub meals are good and the beer was quite nice. The location is great - just 5 minutes to Circular Quay. We felt comfortable walking back from the Opera House at 10 at night. It was hard to beat a rate of $AU 180 for room and breakfast in a location this close to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Upkeep for the Price”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lord Nelson on our first two nights in Australia, paying more than we would have ordinarily for pub accommodations in hopes that we'd have a well-appointed, historic room in a great location. The pub was historic, and the location was good, but unfortunately some of the particulars make me reluctant to recommend this hotel at $180/night. First off, the location in The Rocks is quite convenient, especially if you are, as we were, first time visitors to Australia. The first things we wanted to see in Sydney were the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, so being in The Rocks was perfect. The neighbourhood is quite historic (if a bit rundown), and the decoration of the rooms was well-intentioned when it was first done (although unfortunately it has not been maintained; see below). The pub is popular, but we never heard any noise from it on the fourth floor. Whatever you do, if you stay in the hotel you should avoid room 403, which was our room. It was at the end of the hall, facing directly on the shaft in the middle of the hotel. All you could hear all night (and all day) was the vent fan in the kitchen going on and off -- it was very distracting during sleep. The fan is quite loud and runs most of the time, even in the middle of the night when the kitchen is closed. The room smells strongly of fireplace smoke, which is authentic but leaves you worrying that you and all your clothes reek of smoke. As mentioned above, the room was done in contemporary decor, with nice recessed lighting in the bathroom, nice tile, etc. But housekeeping hasn't been much for maintenance in the last 5 years or so. The lampshade on one of our lamps fell off the wire frame when we turned the bulb on. We left it on the floor for repair, but the maid the next day just balanced it back on the wire frame, where it fell off again immediately when we walked back into the room. The slats in the wooden shutters have fallen off so the shutters let light in early in the morning. Our king-sized bed had a duvet but no dust ruffle, so the bare box spring was exposed, which was unattractive. Also, our maid didn't seem to vacuum in the days we were there; there were a number of long, blonde hairs on the carpet when we arrived and they never moved, which was a bit gross. Other considerations: 1) The rooms on the fourth floor may all (like ours) have skylights. This is lovely during the day, but there's no cover for them, so sleeping in after sunrise is nearly impossible. 2) There's no lift, so you'll be hauling all your luggage up three narrow flights of stairs. 3) Service in general, like the maid service, is rather indifferent. One morning when we needed to leave quite early, we arrived at the dining room when breakfast was supposed to open. We could hear people in the kitchen, but the door was locked and they ignored our knocking. Thirty minutes later they chose to hear it, once there was a line of people waiting to get in. All in all, it's fine for a pub, but not worth $180. You can find a better room, even in Sydney, for $180.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Lttle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vagabondadelmundo
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Sydney at The historic Lord Nelson. I'm not a fan of big corporate hotels so this is perfect if you like simple and quaint. It felt more like staying in a home, but we had our own bathroom(called ensuite) which is optional and a little more $. The room was very clean and comfotable, and the windows open to let in a delicious ocean breeze. A very close walk on cobblestone streets to the Rocks and Circular Quay. Great pub conveniently located downstairs and breakfast was included (excellent cafe lattes)in the Brasserie. On the way to/ from The Rocks, check out Cosi's (very casual)Restaurant for fresh seafood , and what I like call 'Gourmet' fish and chips. If you want to kick it up a few notches without the big hotel bill, go to the top of the Shangri-La for a dizzying selection of cocktails and jaw dropping views.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: HUNTINGPARTY
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel whilst searching for somewhere a bit different for our last night in Australia. Rooms were well equipped and big enough. Breakfast was great - a bit of a treat as mostly we'd been self catering. Only problem was that I had asked for 2 adjacent rooms, one twin, one double and when we arrived the rooms were not together and were both made up as doubles. As the children don't do well sharing a double bed we asked for this to be changed but were told that housekeeping had gone and they couldn't even give us the sheets to do it ourselves, as everything was locked up for the night. Bit of disappointment but we got over it and had a great night out at Doyles on the Rocks where the waitress couldn't have done more for us to make the evening memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Navybluebiplane
Reviews.Content: The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel was our first stop after a 23 hour flight from the UK and the start of a month long trip. It was a good start because this was everything we wanted from a hotel. I thought the price reasonable - we paid $180 per night. Continental breakfast was included (the usual fruit juice and cereal, then two huge doorstep pieces of toast and a skewer of mixed fresh fruit) or, for an extra charge, the chef was in attendance to cook breakfast. The location is fantastic (walking distance to the harbour). I was worried that being a pub, it would be noisy/smoky, but it was very quiet and my sensitive nose did not detect a whiff of smoke seeping up from below floors. Our room was on the 4th floor; ground floor is the pub, lst floor Brasserie and 3rd and 4th hotel rooms. Note there is no lift so tone those biceps for lugging your cases up the stairs. The room itself was small but had everything we needed and there was space to store the suitcases. The bed was huge and VERY comfortable, two huge, pretty bedside lamps, tv and although the window was tiny, there was a skylight so the room was light. Bathroom had a 3/4 bath with shower over; it was nice to have toiletries including body lotion. There was a fax machine and kettle stored in a cupboard and of course, the air conditioning was a must. We arrived first thing and our room wasn't ready but we checked in and were allowed to use a bathroom to freshen up. Our cases were left in the locked office until we returned in the afternoon. My husband tried the beer (his verdict, very good but a bit expensive) but to cap it all, there was the most fantastic fish restaurant (Fish at the Rocks) a hop, skip and jump away from the Lord Nelson where we had one of the best meals of our holiday. Best of all, they had a deal that if you were out by 19.45, two courses cost $40. It suited us find as we needed an early night after our flight. The fish was so fresh, thinking about it makes my mouth water! Anyway, would definately recommend the Lord Nelson. We stayed at the 'boutique' Pensione in George Street after a trip to the Blue Mountains, simply because it was a comparable price and it was near the train station, but it was rubbish compared to the Lord Nelson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel, supposedly the oldest in Sydney. An added bonus is the pub downstairs, which brews their own beer... mightily delicious beer as well! There are only 5 rooms, and they're not big or fancy, but it's a cultural experience... if you want big, go stay at the Sheraton. It's located out of the most touristy section of The Rocks, so it's quiet and there's not much traffic, but a five-minute walk will bring you right to Circular Quay and into the heart of things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere EVEN BETTER BEER!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were going on a trip to Australia and happened to be looking for a room when we stumbled across the Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel! This place is great! We new we had scored when we walked in and found that the rooms were up stairs above the bar. These guys make some of the BEST BEER I have ever tasted! The Old Admiral and Three Sheets had to be my favorites. The cost for us was 180 a night Australian which at the time was about 90 a night in American Dollars. The ONLY drawback about this place was that you had to walk several flights of stairs to get to the rooms. This may not seem difficult, but when you are half tanked on the Golden blood of the Gods, it gets a little tricky. :)

HotelInfo.Name: The Lord Nelson Brewery Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cnr Kent and Argyle Sts. | The Rocks, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
